recordings.rmk: HP 12dB/oct at 200 Hz .   Singing from the top of solitary low tree in agriculture area with meadows  and fields. Female nearby was watching the situation from a stone with a large grasshopper  in her beak ready to feed her chicks.
HP 12dB/oct at 200 Hz .    At  **0:04**   A deviant call is heard which may be a different species .

**Comments**: None.

**Recording modifications**: No edits. Recorded using Olympus LS-P1.

**Habitat (inc. vegetation and level)**: Cereal fields and meadows with a passing river. Bird on the top of canopy growing on the side of the river.

**Behaviour**: Singing from the top of the canopy while perched still.

**Sex (with ID cues)**: None.

**Weather and other conditions**: Slightly windy and cloudy afternoon.

**Comments on other birds**: Golden oriole and yellowhammer singing throughout. Calls of hooded crow and song of European skylarks later in the recording.
2 types of alarm call, with a lower coarser call for e.g. at 2.5 seconds

A Corn Bunting singing from a small area of scrub in arable farmland. 

Recorded with an Olympus LS-12 and Sennheiser ME66 handheld on a glorious warm morning. Lightly edited below 1600 Hz to remove some handling noise and deep rumble.

A Corn Bunting singing from a small area of scrub in arable farmland. There is also quite a loud Whitethoat singing, but its verses usually avoid overlapping with the Corn Bunting. 

Recorded with an Olympus LS-12 and Sennheiser ME66 handheld on a glorious warm morning. Edited below 2000 Hz to remove some handling, wind and vehicle noise.
